hipi.imagebundle
Class HipiImageBundle.FileReader

java.lang.Object
  hipi.imagebundle.HipiImageBundle.FileReader
Enclosing class:
HipiImageBundle
public static class HipiImageBundle.FileReader
extends java.lang.Object

The reader class provides a simple interface for reading images from a HipiImageBundle so that the HipiImageBundle can be split into multiple sections and be read in parallel. This It is used heavily by ImageBundleInputFormat and ImageBundleRecordReader for MapReduce jobs because of this parallelism.

Method Detail

getProgress

public float getProgress()
Returns:
The progress of reading through the HipiImageBundle according to the start and end specified in the constructor

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

nextKeyValue

public boolean nextKeyValue()
Reads the next image in the HipiImageBundle into a cache. Images are not decoded in this method. To get the corresponding FloatImage and ImageHeader you must call getCurrentValue() and getCurrentKey() respectively.

Returns:
True if the reader could get the next image from the HipiImageBundle. False if there are no more images or an error occurred.

getRawBytes

public byte[] getRawBytes()
                   throws java.io.IOException
Returns:
Raw byte array containing the image as stored in the HipiImageBundle. The image will not be decoded into an FloatImage.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getCurrentKey

public ImageHeader getCurrentKey()
                          throws java.io.IOException
Returns:
ImageHeader of the current image, as retrieved by nextKeyValue()
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getCurrentValue

public FloatImage getCurrentValue()
                           throws java.io.IOException
Returns:
Decoded image as a FloatImage, as retrieved by nextKeyValue()
Throws:
java.io.IOException
